website_summaries.verdict: A low-priced curling iron that delivers exceptional quality.
pros: Clamp reliably holds hair to the heat source without slippage
cons: Rare complaints from owners that the clamp is too tight

customer_reviews.title: Hair gets caught and pulled out
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this curling iron. It’s quick to heat up, it’s a good size and length, stylish, and it seemed to heat evenly. There was one huge, can-not-ignore fault that is a complete dealbreaker: the screw that holds the clamp onto the iron catches and pulls the hair. My hair was caught almost every time I curled and it yanked and tore hair out of my head (so painful). I tried a few different times and tried using different methods, angles, and products to help and nothing prevented the pain and the catching. AVOID THIS IRON.
customer_reviews.author: MommaLazer

customer_reviews.title: Curling iron problem. See photo
customer_reviews.text: I like this curling iron with one exception. The tip is shaped like a citrus juicer which makes it hard to grasp the end while winding the hair around the curler. I have burned my fingers numerous of times, due to this design. The tip needs to be "elongated" instead of "juicer" shaped.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Wife likes it weeks after getting it
customer_reviews.text: My wife needed a new hair tool and sent me the link to order this one. I have no clue what makes one of these good or bad so please don't ask me on this. All I can say is she researched for two days before deciding on this one and when she got it she was super excited. Its been a few weeks now and she told me it doesn't do any damage to her hair and that she really likes it still. I hope this helps anyone reading this
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Calderone

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Impressive Curling Iron
customer_reviews.text: I am a novice hair-curler at best, but from my first use with this iron I've had only good experiences. It grips my fine hair perfectly and makes great curls that last all day. I haven't had any issue with accidentally turning it off or changing the heat setting. The tip is a nice size for gripping. I was surprised to get such a high-quality curling iron for such a low price!
customer_reviews.author: S. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: this is OK
customer_reviews.text: I needed a curling iron and could not spend a bunch of money. This says it is a ceramic curling iron so I thought why not. Well I use it on low since I have fine thin hair. to protect it I use the lowest heat and a spray to protect it. But this thing gets HOT. And there is no place to hold on to the end. I can not tell you how many times I have burnt myself on this thing. Oh well I guess you get what you pay for. I will be replacing it soon with something that has more heat control and a place to actually hold the end.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Kincaid

customer_reviews.title: This curling iron has the potential to be wonderful. However when it was built the clamp is ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st rating review despite buying things off Amazon often. This curling iron has the potential to be wonderful. However when it was built the clamp was lined up incorrectly and it is loose on one side, to the point that my hair slides right out. Yet it is so tight on the other side that it is tearing my hair out. See photos below. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the new version
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older one of the same model which died after daily use for 5 years. This replacement is overall so much cheaper feeling, the heat selector doesn't seem to do anything - it just gets really hot no matter what setting you put it on. Just nowhere near as good a product. Also it didn't come with a removable heat shield that came with the first one (fortunately I saved mine and was able to use the old heat shield on the new wand). Honestly - wouldn't buy another one. I will start shopping for a better one now and give this to the local thrift store when I find what I want.
customer_reviews.author: BookSeller

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with this line of curling irons
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this line of curling irons. I have fine and sometimes frizzy hair, and often find it difficult to hold a style.The high heat achieves a perfect lasting curl every time, but does not burn my hair. My first purchase was the 1", and I loved it so much I went ahead and purchased both the 1-1/4" and 1-1/2". All three are amazing! And you cannot beat the price for this quality! Now the only problem I have is deciding which one to use! Two thumbs way up on this line!!
customer_reviews.author: Marlena

customer_reviews.title: My hair’s best friend for 12 years
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these last over 12 years. It just died on me during Coronavirus quarantine. I replaced it with another one. All years later the design and quality is the same. My hair dresser and Aveda Salon owner who uses all the latest fancy hot tools and Aveda products teases me about my conair infinity. I tell him, “it’s like one of those trusty old cars that never dies.” Well it finally did. But how can complain? This $20 curling iron was my thick, poofy, hairs’ bff for twelve long years. It smooths and tames my mane without pulling it. Gives me the perfect beachy, instagram blogger-worthy waves every time... Buy it. You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylia

customer_reviews.title: Good basic curling iron
customer_reviews.text: I needed to curl my daughters' hair for an event, and it was time to replace my old curling iron that I hadn't used in 12 or more years. I din't want to spend a ton of money, either, since I usually just use a straightening iron. This curling iron worked very well, was easy to use, and heated up quickly enough for my liking.
customer_reviews.author: jpevball9

customer_reviews.title: gets hot fast, multiple heat settings
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my shoulder length hair. Gives me just a bit of volume and body while smoothing my hair. It has multiple heat settings which is nice, the hotter it is, the more curl you get, so if you want less curl, and more smoothing/volume action, choose a lower heat setting. I especially like the plastic guard, so you can put it in the sleeve while it's still hot to protect from melting your other belongings.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bourgeois

customer_reviews.title: Hinges don't tear out your hair
customer_reviews.text: Other curling irons have little hinges that always seem to grab pieces of my hair and pull them out... OUCH! The Conair Infinity Pro has a different hinge design that doesn't do that. I have another one that 1-1/4" I've used for years and wanted one that was 1-1'2" since my hair is longer now. I bought a Conair Infinity Pro again. They work well, heat fast, don't catch my hair in the hinges. When I received this new 1-1/2" iron, it would turn on, but temp settings didn't work so I'm returning it. I will, however be ordering a replacement. I really like this brand and model.
customer_reviews.author: KP in Tucson

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as my original larger model
customer_reviews.text: I have a larger model of this curling iron and they really make it well. I purchased one of these brush/blowers but I believe it is made for very fine hair because it doesn't have enough bristles and it really does not straighten your hair as they advertise -- BUT THIS DEVICE, is fantastic. I just took one strand of hair after another and my hair came out beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: JaimeIsaac

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: I let this thing heat up for a bit on the highest setting,sprayed every piece of my hair before curling and none of it held. A waste of money in my opinion. I have this same iron in 1/2 inch barrel and I love it so I expected the same from this just with larger curls but it doesnt work.
customer_reviews.author: Cloey E.

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well
customer_reviews.text: I have short, thin hair. Whether using it immediately after drying my hair or the next day for a touch up, this curling iron does a great job. It has several heat settings that are easy to adjust. The iron itself is lightweight, which is a factor for my arthritic hands. The barrel size is perfect for my short hair.
customer_reviews.author: SoozeSays

customer_reviews.title: Worst. Curling. Iron. EVERRRR.
customer_reviews.text: Ooh my goodness...I hated this curling iron! I threw it away and didn't even bother trying to use it again. The design on the barrel itself left kinks in my hair and it didn't curl right. I'm not using Conair anything anymore since they always disappoint me. I got a Hot Tools curling iron instead, and it works beautifully. Save yourself the money and trouble, and get a Hot Tools barrel. They aren't that expensive on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this curling iron two months ago. Worked fine until about one week ago. Now, it keeps shutting off, in the middle of use. Just passed the window to be able to return it. I won’t buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: E. Piaf

customer_reviews.title: Great iron, except for the tip.
customer_reviews.text: This curling iron is, overall, great. I love that I don't have to dry my thick hair completely before using it. The barrel feels very smooth on the hair and glides easily. My only issue is that the "cool tip" it too small. Curling the left side of my head was difficult because I had to be super careful to not let my fingers slip down to the heated portion of the barrel. I am going to find a heat-resistant glove to use with this iron.
customer_reviews.author: JosieJ

customer_reviews.title: Barrel is good size but didnt like short handle or curler head
customer_reviews.text: Barrel is good size but didnt like short handle or curler head. Gets hot but larger curl, for a different look and i have long hair. Just a different look. Not as flexable As hot tool or just longer barrel curling irons. Good for price but would have just bought one for 40-50 if i could return. But i cant. Waited too long. Handle clasp was tight and didnt want to grab hair. Would get caught in clasp. Pretty much what u got here is a great basic for the price but the actual ingenering and placement of screws abd such make the iron annoying.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Bad smell!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this iron very little, I mean very little. There is no product on it. Yesterday I pulled it out to use and it heated up and there was a very nauseating smell coming off of it. I did a few curls and this horrid smell was now in my hair. I couldn't stand it and had to wash it out of my hair and I could still smell it. These things made overseas, you don't know what they use, things could eventually get toxic just sitting on a shelf. I cannot even imagine why this smell all of a sudden started up when the few other times I used it, there was no smell. I cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: scrappy1

customer_reviews.title: Burned fingers
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy a Conair curling iron to replace my old one which had lasted several years before it stopped working. Just like another reviewer, I found the end piece to be too small. Because of the tapered end, it is hard to keep your fingers away from the hot metal while trying to hold the curling iron in place. I've only used it once, but after burning my fingers a couple of times, it is going into my "future garage sale" box. When I shop for another curling iron, I will be very aware of the shape and size of the end piece. I'm very disappointed because I did like the other features of the curling iron.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my short hair
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had to use a curling iron in over 10 years but because of covid I haven't gotten to the salon in 5 months. So I needed one. I love this one. The heat is perfect. You can control how much or little you need. It also comes with a cover so when you're done with it you can cover it so you can be assured it's not going to touch anything if it still may be a bit hot
customer_reviews.author: Gini Risinger

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but found the one I had lost
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I had actually bought it since I thought I had lost my curling iron that was this exact same brand and whatnot but size 1 1/4. After this one arrived the one i thought I had lost was found so I'm returning it because it feels silly for me to have 2 curling irons that are soo close in size. But I love the other curling iron I have and would recommend this product to anyone whose in the market to buying one.
customer_reviews.author: haley

customer_reviews.title: Really good curling iron
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult finding just what I wanted in a curling iron. This one fit the bill. Right size, temp control, and even a curling rod protector. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mari Jean

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: The curling iron functions well, but it’s very easy to inadvertently turn off because of where the power and temperature control buttons are located. When gripping and turning the iron, my right thumb invariably pushes those buttons. The other thing that isn’t great is the design of the tip of the curling iron, that you hold with your other hand. It’s tapered and ribbed, and in order to get a good grip on it that doesn’t slip right off, I find myself having to grasp too close to the hot iron, and I burned my thumb a couple of times. I have to use a glove on my left hand now to avoid burns.
customer_reviews.author: srg

customer_reviews.title: Good Curl, caught hair and burnt fingers.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this curling iron based on the reviews. The reviews were pretty spot on. Sometimes hair does get caught on the screws of the clamp, not horribly. Sometimes my fingers slip off the rounded end and get burnt, not bad enough to cry about, but enough to notice. If you can deal with these nuisances it’s worth the price, yet you could most likely find another iron for the same price that doesn’t have these issues.
customer_reviews.author: JW of MN

customer_reviews.title: Heats up super quick
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how much I like this curling iron. It is so much cheaper than more expensive ones I own and works substantially better. The tourmaline really does help if you have thin hair. The only drawback is that the tip is not quite big enough for me although I do have another curling iron that's even wrose. You really have to be conscious of this so you don't burn your fingers. It would be the holy grail of curling irons if not for that.
customer_reviews.author: 1Barkeep

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping to find a curler for fine hair that would give a nice curl that lasted longer than an hour. This was not it. I've used curling irons before but this one kept creasing my hair, my curls wouldn't even last until I was finished with all of my hair. So disappointing. I tried different settings, holding the curl until it cooled, etc but I couldn't find a reason to like this curler. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: GOOD FOR ONLY THREE MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for about three months then it just stopped working altogether. The indicator lights went on but it never heated up :(
customer_reviews.author: Hawaiian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I love this curling wand. The heating temperatures are great, they heat up quickly, and don't burn your hand. I'm very satisfied with this product. You can look like a celeb without paying a ton of money. It's easy to hold and has a nice look to it as well. FYI: To the customer who complained about their hair: If you had trouble with this wand try some YouTube videos on HOW to properly curl your hair. It's not the wand's fault your hair fell out! There is a BIG warning label attached saying keep a way from eyes and children.
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Love this curling iron!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have purchased this product. I dropped my first one after having it for about five years and be heat resistant tip broke off the end so I had to get another one. For not being one of the high end curling irons, this one really holds a curl well. It gets very hot and I am very pleased with it. Be sure to spray your hair with a heat protectant with any curling iron. There’s no need to buy $100-$200 curling Iron when this one works just as well. I have had both kinds.
customer_reviews.author: T. Birdsong

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the infinity pro used to be.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that I got better results from the older, non "ceramic" Infiniti pro. I know ceramic is the newer feature, or "thing", if you will, but the older version gave me better, longer lasting results. It's okay, It just isn't what I expected or hoped for. It will curl your hair but the curls won't be as intense or last nearly as long. I'd it's all we have to choose from these days, it will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Hyso

customer_reviews.title: ... It comes with a plastic heat cover which I like better than the cloth ones I have with other ...
customer_reviews.text: This heats up quick It comes with a plastic heat cover which I like better than the cloth ones I have with other irons because it stays on when I slide it in and out of my cabinet. It doesn't produce a funky ridge in my hair like many other irons have. I do not like the visible screw that connects the clip - someone else mentioned this too. I didn't think it would bother me but if I am not careful I get hair stuck in there and I pull it out. Its not a deal beaker for me but I think its poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Monica D.

customer_reviews.title: It heats really fast so be careful where you rest it!
customer_reviews.text: The colour and size is true to the device! I love the barrel and the temperature control and settings. I had the setting on 1 and got the nicest curls. I tried the 30 seconds hold, and it is true, it is really true about the curls. The dial on the side starts at 1 and goes up to 30, and I am not sure I will need it all the way up at 30! It worked fine at 1. This is a must have and it has the cutest little stand to prevent it from scorching the surface of anywhere you put it down! I would recommend this product for sure. A must have!!
customer_reviews.author: Saynia

customer_reviews.title: First one I order didn't work, second one OK
customer_reviews.text: In all fairness, it is a good product, however my experience is not the best. The first one I ordered didn't work, wouldn't even turn on and the buttons seemed damaged. I returned it and ordered a replacement. When the replacement came I noticed the difference between the way both items were packed, so I figured the first one was returned by someone else, because it was missing a lot of the packing materials that usually come with new items.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great job on my fine straight hair
customer_reviews.text: as everyone else is saying about this product it does keep a curl long! I can sometimes still have curl the next day after sleeping on it! I am pleased with the product nothing I would say against it at this point. I even like the heat protector that goes over it while it is cooling down. I have actually burned myself less and less as I have been using it. My other one for whatever reason I would get in the way of the heat barrel!
customer_reviews.author: So Little Time...

customer_reviews.title: Description not accurate.
customer_reviews.text: It does NOT give loose or tight curls as it states in the features. You can get one sized very loose “curl.” I wouldn’t even consider what it provides a loose curl because it doesn’t heat up enough to even hold a decent loose curl. You also can’t hold the tip as you’re curling as you would with any other curling device because the area is so small you will burn your finger.
customer_reviews.author: Kels

customer_reviews.title: Great curling iron
customer_reviews.text: Heated up quick. Was the perfect size. I ordered the 1inch for these curls. Very happy with the price and product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Leland

customer_reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL LASTING CURLS! But has 2 CONS!
customer_reviews.text: This curling iron works great! My curls lasted all day! Definitely recommend! I have 2 complaints...it snags your hair! May consider purchasing with longer barrel for longer hair and it turns off all the time because of where the button is located
customer_reviews.author: Gina Salinas

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable Long Lasting Curling Iron
customer_reviews.text: I bought this curling iron over 3 years ago on Amazon and it has never failed. It heats up very quickly. I use the lowest setting because I have fine curly colored hair and use it mostly for straightening. I spray the ends with heat spray, let it dry a little and roll each section. It leaves my hair shiny and the curls last a lot longer than just rolling them wet with regular curlers (which I also do). It's a breeze to clean, too. Plus I love the barrel cover that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte G.

customer_reviews.title: Love this curling iron
customer_reviews.text: I use every day, it heats up fast. Great quality, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jen B

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t curl
customer_reviews.text: It sucked. I read all the reviews and figured I would give it a shot and it wouldn’t curl at all. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Perfect long lasting curls
customer_reviews.text: Previously bought the same iron but with 1 1/4 in. barrel. Wanted tighter curls but my current 3/4 in. iron pulled my hair when I used it. Loved how smoothly my hair wrapped around my larger titanium one. So glad I got this replacement. Create beautiful long lasting curls. Even lasts second day, they are just looser. I even use at 310, lowest heat setting. I have a thick head of fine textured hair about 4 inches below my shoulder. When curled, my hair sits just below shoulders. Tip: let curls cool before separating each one to create more volume.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Mills

customer_reviews.title: Affordable curling iron that gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: This curling iron heat up very quickly and distributed the heat styling my hair well. I also find that it's not as damaging to my hair with a nice heat protectant spray. I wish it had lower heat settings though. My curls don't stay coiled tightly but settle into soft waves. I use the Revlon curling wand for longer lasting curl though. However, I find myself reaching for this curling iron more since it's easier to use and doesn't require both hands at all times to finagle with my hair.
customer_reviews.author: Cee

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I dont do my hair very often, I havnt found a nice curling iron/wand until now! I like to curl my hair every now and then, but needed something I could use easily, and quickly. I love the temperature control, and how easy it is to use! I dont know anything about curling hair so this was a great buy for me! Love that I can curl my hair, and it looks great every time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Both good and bad...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great curling iron overall, but it does have a few flaws. Pros: Light weight Heats up quickly Produces loose, beautiful waves Variable heat settings Cons: The barrel is a little short. The plastic end cap is very small which makes it far too easy to burn one's fingers (this actually happened to me for the first time in approximately 27 years of curling my hair!) My hair has gotten tangled and pulled out by the springs holding the clamp. After weighing both the good and the bad, my opinion is that this is a good choice for a curling iron in this price range. Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Lori K. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work for me ... too hot.
customer_reviews.text: This iron is hot!!!! Temperature wise!! I have short hair and was interested in helping with volume for my hair. The lowest setting is 310 which is too hot for my fine hair. My hair is fried even with a heat protectant. I only passed over my hair for a matter of half a second. Otherwise, the barrel is nice. Nice electronic heat setting.. i just think its suitable for thick, long hair . Returned unfortunately. Didnt give it a low rating because it just didnt work for my hair. Short, relaxed hair.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: Piece of non-working junk
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money! The end of the curling iron is too small and doesn't leave enough room for your fingers, and after having it for just over two months, it completely stopped working (in the middle of fixing my hair!). Of course, it's outside the return window now and I'm stuck with a piece of junk that is going in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Noll

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this does the job. My only complaint: the black plastic end of the iron is not long enough to hold while using the iron. My previous Conair curling iron had an end that was about 2 inches long so I could hold onto it while curling hair over the iron.
customer_reviews.author: Linda D

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING curling iron
customer_reviews.text: Edit to add that I've now had this curling iron for over a year and it's the best I've ever had. And I even have several l'ange wands! Smooths my frizzy hair as it curls, heats up quickly... It's amazing! AMAZING curling iron! heats up very quickly, is very very hot, glides extremely well on the hair, and doesnt seem to burn the hair! If im being extremely picky the length of the barrel could be a teensy bit longer, but i have very long and thick hair. And sometimes it catches some hair in the screws, and that is unpleasant. Overall i love the iron and would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: shopgirl2012

customer_reviews.title: Great product and they thought of everything
customer_reviews.text: This iron is very HOT!! I have used irons for many years and the lowest this setting goes is 240 and up to 400. I have fine, silky hair and it has fried the ends. I barely touched my wrist and have a nasty burn. It is hard to curl my hair with a glove on. I guess when they give you a heat protectant glove , I should have taken the hint.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Gave my naturally curly hair big, beautiful waves.
customer_reviews.text: I have naturally curly (3c) hair, and I wanted big, loose waves for my bridesmaid hairdo in my cousin's wedding. This curling iron delivered. It also traveled well, and the heat protection cover was useful, especially in a cramped hotel room of four people. Definitely worth it. Unfortunately my hairstyle didn't make it to the ceremony or reception because it was incredibly windy that day, but I think that has more to do with mother nature and the fact that I got ready before arriving at the venue and didn't plan for touch ups.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Heats quickly!
customer_reviews.text: Heats quickly and gets very hot like a professional stylist. I like the heat storage collar. It lets you put it away while still hot. The heat controls are easy to use and don't easily get bumped while in use to accidentally turn it off or down. I wish the tip end was a little bigger so you could actually put a few fingers around it without getting burned.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Best curling iron!!!! Beats higher priced brands!
customer_reviews.text: A family member had this curling iron and after I used it I was hooked! I ordered one and I love it so much. It’s so easy to use and the size is perfect. I love the case that goes over the part that gets hot so you can store it before it cools down. I’ve used more expensive ones but this one blows them away in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: L.S.

customer_reviews.title: It has good shaping effect and glossy hair
customer_reviews.text: It's very convenient to use this kind of hair curler. It's very convenient to use it. It's very nice to use the curling stick. It's very nice to use the curling bar. It's very nice to use the curling stick. It's very nice to use. It doesn't have a nice curling effect. It's very nice to use the curling stick. It's very nice to use. It's not a good place to use the curling stick. It's very nice to use.
customer_reviews.author: James Crowhurst

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't hold a curl in easy to curl hair
customer_reviews.text: I am very particular about hair and beauty and read a ton of reviews before purchasing these types of products. I usually love my Conair hair tools. However, this just did not work for me. I have very easy to curl hair and whenever I use this iron the curl just does not hold. I was debating between this iron and the cheaper Conair clamp curling iron since I used to have that one in a smaller size (stopped working but only after about 5 years) and I wish I went with that one instead. Wouldn't recommend this iron for any hair type.
customer_reviews.author: NS

customer_reviews.title: This iron was just bought in Sept 2019
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this iron for many yrs and bought the last one in Sept. 2019. It is already rusting. I have never had one rust before and am very upset over this and will never buy another one like this. Conair is certainly not the company they used to be! Nor are their products.
customer_reviews.author: linda smith

customer_reviews.title: BEST curling iron
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best curling iron I've ever bought. I've bought others that supposedly get just as hit, but they've never worked as well as this one. My hair is very thick. This curling iron can handle it. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars instead if 5 is because a screw popped off, but I've had it forever. I just purchased another one.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Best I've used
customer_reviews.text: It gets hot fast and is easy to use. If your hair is getting stuck around the thumb grip, then you're trying to curl too much hair at once. My hair is thick and wiry, but even while curling 2 inch sections of hair at a time, the process doesn't take long at all because it holds the heat at a consistent temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Mary_

customer_reviews.title: Replacement Curling Iron
customer_reviews.text: Wife was given this model from a friend to use and it wouldn't heat anymore. Replaced it with the same one after researching different options and this was preferred by my wife. She appreciates the iron cover. Easy to use for all day curls. She's pretty quick with this now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great iron
customer_reviews.text: I was debating on whether or not I wanted a wand or an iron with a clip. I decided to get this one so I can use it as a wand or use the clip. I definitely should have gotten the wand because this leaves big lines but I am probably doing it wrong. I REALLY love Conair's line and I like this iron a lot. It heats up so quick which is a big plus. I like the spinning cord so I can move freely. All in all, it is a great tool. Also, I have fine hair that is easily damaged. This type of iron has done well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie King

customer_reviews.title: It's hard to grip
customer_reviews.text: It burns!!!!!! No seriously. The point end is too small and you can't grip the end. AND the end is also slick so it's nerve racking to use. I can not use it without a glove. And it takes too long to curl because you're trying to get a right grip and in the meantime your hair is burning off.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Curl tastic
customer_reviews.text: I have very fine hair and a terrifically difficultly time to get it to, not only curl, but stay curled. This curling iron has multiple temperature settings which makes it easy to choose the correct temperature to curl any hair texture. From the first time I used it I was amazed at its ability to curl my hair (on the highest temperature setting) and the curl stayed. I would highly recommend this curling iron to anyone, especially the curl challenged as myself. The price was so reasonable. I would definitely rate this a 5 out 5
customer_reviews.author: Sandien

customer_reviews.title: Hair catches in screws
customer_reviews.text: I thought I really liked this curling iron because of the ceramic coating. It curls okay, but not great. The biggest problem I have with it is that my hair got caught and tangled in the screws that hold the clamp. I had to break my hair to let it loose. I was really disappointed. I have medium length, medium thick hair and it damaged my hair. I will be returning it this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: A quality curling iron
customer_reviews.text: I tried it right away and it works just like I saw it work in the video. Easy to adjust the temp and comfortable to hold and use. Love the appearance also. Has a heat shield for storage which is a great plus. I use it every day and do love it. Also it heats up very fast!
customer_reviews.author: Peg C

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I had the 1 inch version of this curler so I decided to go with the same brand for the larger size and I love it! My only wish is that the barrel was a little longer to hold an entire strand of my hair, but that may just be because I have very long hair. Even so, it still works great, I just have to maneuver it a little differently to fit it all onto the curler
customer_reviews.author: Holly Lively

customer_reviews.title: Best curling iron
customer_reviews.text: A great curling iron with a textured surface that grips the hair instead of the shiny metal types. The tip is a good size so you can assist with curling without burning fingers. Multiple heat settings. Comes a protective barrel case to store after usage. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Middle Sister

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price. I have burnt my hand ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok for the price. I have burnt my hand on a couple occasions as somebody else pointed out the tip of the curling iron has a small knob you're supposed to grab onto but it's so small that you actually can touch the actual curling iron. There's nowhere to grab . Next time ill spring an extra five dollars and get one that actually has a larger end
customer_reviews.author: Starla

customer_reviews.title: Best curling iron I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: This curling iron, despite it's super reasonable price, has served me well for almost a decade. I had to buy a new one only because the connection on this one finally came lose. I have taken this iron to numerous hair appointments and even my hoity-toity stylist admits that this iron out preforms her professional ones in the salon.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, no snagging and great price!
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed how great this curling iron is for the price. It is very easy to use, creates lovely curls and you can use it as a wand as well. To use it was a wand, wrap your hair around the barrel without pressing down on the clip/clamp handle. The wand method will create a different wave/curl which makes this product very versatile. My only complaint would be that the handle burned my neck. I am used to the clamp handle having more covering over the metal so I inadvertently burned myself on my neck from the side of the handle. Otherwise, great product and nice color too!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Maureschat

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: It heats up quickly, gets hot enough to curl my stubborn hair without damaging it & my hair flows though it easily when I am done curing it. The ONLY downside I have found is that it doesn't have a "hook." I usually use the "stand" that supports a curling iron to hang it on the wall for storage but this one has a plastic piece for support instead. That's ok. It's a great product and I have adapted.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B.

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT curling iron!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this curling iron, it arrived with a little case to put over the barrel which is perfect for traveling. I love how it curls, or straightens my thin hair. It heats up fast and cools down just as fast.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: This curling iron is.. OK, I guess. If I use a ton of hairspray, the curl will hold, but without hair spray pre-iron, you literally cannot tell my hair had ever seen a curling iron. Usually, my hair will look curly right when I use an iron but as the day/night goes on, the curls will softly fall out, if I didn't use hair spray. This iron requires a FULL coating of hair spray to my hair immediately before curling for it to look curly/wavy at all, which meant I had that unpleasant burning/crispy hair situation. The price was good and it's not worth the hassle of returning, but I would not buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement over older model
customer_reviews.text: I bought this curling iron with reservation as I had a older model 2012? that was just adequate. The ceramic coated material on the wand makes it work better and hair slide through the clamped tube. Also, no waiting for it to heat up... super hot before I could even run a brush thoroughly through my hair! I only use on medium heat setting...still very hot.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Croteau

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Same as my 1” which I love. These are easy to use, heats fast, works great.
customer_reviews.author: Sandee

customer_reviews.title: Yup
customer_reviews.text: This is a good curling iron and it's got a heat sleeve. I mention the heat sleeve because I've got a curious little one and an clumsy, haven't hurt myself with this one, knock on wood. The heat control is amazing! I use this curling iron to style my synthetic wigs and they look great!
customer_reviews.author: LeisurelyDiva

customer_reviews.title: Love but not as much as 1.25
customer_reviews.text: Love the Conair Inifiniti line. This barrel doesn’t hold curls as well as my 1.25 barrel though. Still an excellent curling iron for the price.
customer_reviews.author: dmc0708

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine and wife is meh about this. Nothing extraordinary functionality but cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine and wife is meh about this. Nothing extraordinary functionality but cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Atul Singh

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the size of this barrel and i can tell it's of good quality, the only negative i can say is that it clamps down almost too tightly, that it made it difficult for me to twirl my hair through it without fearing it will rip straight out of my head. It was hard for me to find a balance on how much to press down without all my hair falling out of the barrel. I guess i just need a little more practice, other than that, my curls turned out beautiful, was great compared to those i've used for 3 x the price.
customer_reviews.author: SaraPo

customer_reviews.title: Okay product.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a curler that was affordable and did its job and saw that this one had lots of reviews so I gave it a go. Tried it out for a few days and never really curled my hair. The high setting gave off a weird smell and the lower setting didnt hold a consistent heat. Picture and description does not paint accurate description. Not good for when it's a bit wet cuz it doesnt have any vents
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like the feel of the iron as I slid it ...
customer_reviews.text: Because of the smallish tapered end of the iron, I burned my hand three times in three different attempts. The grip for the handle is wide, so that my fingers really had to stretch to grasp and squeeze. I didn't like the feel of the iron as I slid it down the hair. It heated quickly and worked, but the negatives were too many for me to keep.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy buyer

customer_reviews.title: I have fairly long thick hair with natural waves. ...
customer_reviews.text: I have fairly long thick hair with natural waves. My last conair iron helped me set polished waves, so when it died I "upgraded" by getting this tourmaline ceramic one. I don't know if it's the coating or what, but using the same heat settings this iron makes my hair look thin and flat. I've been trying to use it for months and get the same results each time no matter how I try to change my technique.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Heats up super quick!
customer_reviews.text: This curling iron heats up really fast which is nice for quick on-the-go hairstyles. Previous experience with Conair hair products they last a good long time. Why pay for overpriced stylist tools when this one will meet all your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: 3 things I love about this product:
customer_reviews.text: Great price, excellent quality, and is still working well over 5 years. I use this more than my expensive straightener because it straightens pretty well and gives a little bounce. I get lots of compliments when I use this.
customer_reviews.author: afizzo

customer_reviews.title: Got a lemon
customer_reviews.text: My hair doesn't glide through the iron. It gets stuck. Something about the iron prevents my hair from sliding. I've tried multiple ways to clean the iron but it appears to have paint or metal defects on the barrel that make it unusable. I've had this model in the past. Only difference I can see on the one that worked vs this one is small slits in the iron clip. Returning this lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Diane R. Insari

customer_reviews.title: great curling irom
customer_reviews.text: replacement and I love it more than the curling iron it replaced
customer_reviews.author: Yve-Va

customer_reviews.title: Curl your hair!
customer_reviews.text: If you haven't bought a new iron in a few years you'll be very happy! I didn't realize my old one was so shot. This one heats up fast, has lots of control, and grips your hair nicely for fast curls. The sleeve protects it when storing or when packed for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Anne L.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It leave a kink in your hair where your hair goes over the barrel its not too noticable and it could be a problem with all traditional style curling irons. It does hold the curls very well, the cord doesn't tangle and the fact the tip does not get hot is vital. Overall its a good curling iron for the price but nothing spectacular.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Returning.
customer_reviews.text: The curling iron doesn't curl hair very well. If you have thick hair, it will not even get hot enough to curl. I usually curl my hair at 375 degrees but my hair went even curl when I put the curling iron all the way to 400 degrees. Probably one of the worst curling irons I've ever had. Maybe I just have a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: Shuntina Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Short barrel, lightweight iron
customer_reviews.text: This is a short barrel. I purchased after reading reviews but I was still disappointed. I have a medium a-line bob and this barrel is to short for wavy curls. It works fine, bears io great but feels light weight and cheap compared to my professional tools. I need to spend more money for a better quality curling iron, this won’t work for my hair
customer_reviews.author: Jennywren

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: Very smooth.. glides through my thick, course, curly hair like butter. Also plenty hot on 350. Huge difference between this and the $10 Revlon piece of junk. Great quality for the price. Not sure how the $50 versions could be much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff's Jen

customer_reviews.title: Very good overall.
customer_reviews.text: I have thin, fine, straight, "silver" hair. My hair is also short and I like it kind of fluffy. Hot rollers won't stay in. My 3/4" butane curling iron makes my hair too curly. This one give me the body and volume I like. I'd give it 5 stars except for two things. One, you must start with the iron at the "end" of the hair, otherwise you get a clamp mark near the root. Two, I'e prefer a bit longer cool tip.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Reader

customer_reviews.title: Love this curling wand
customer_reviews.text: I will tell you that this wand typically last about one (1) year. I am on my third one. However, I do love the ceramic base, the long cord and the curls it gives my hair. Since I only curl my hair about once a week, plus I keep the ceramic protector on it - I feel it should last at least 24 months
customer_reviews.author: Skye

customer_reviews.title: Not good for fine straight hair.
customer_reviews.text: I could see this curling iron being wonderful for hair with a natural wave. I have very straight very fine hair. I tried over and over and as soon as I’d finish one side, the other side of curls had fallen out. If your hair is like mine, this may not work for you.
customer_reviews.author: SavannahD.

customer_reviews.title: Heats fast, lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Heats fast, lightweight. Easy to use. I just got it, have a similar Conair 1" with dual voltage, still wotking but it's tip broke off when it fell while traveling . So I ordered another Conair . Like the protective slip on shield , handy when traveling, it can be put away, while it is still hot.
customer_reviews.author: M.L.K.

customer_reviews.title: Burned my fingers on first use!
customer_reviews.text: The product heats up quickly, but the tip of the wand is too small. Due to the rounded shape of the wand tip, there is no place for your fingers to hold on to comfortably. Burned my fingers on first use! The wand can be set up to 400 degrees, so you need to be very careful. Would not recommend this product, there are others out there that are better designed.
customer_reviews.author: Christi Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: Heats up in nothing flat; hair always releases, never gets stuck; makes a nice curl quickly. Would recommend. Needs more clear instructions IMHO, but i figured it out anyway. Be careful to only touch the coated tip and handle! Love the cap to cover it when you're done so you can put it away, no need to wait for a cool down period.
customer_reviews.author: bjb

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: I have tried tons of curling irons (cheap and super expensive) this is the only one that WORKS as it should. My hair is fine and gets frizzy at the first sign of moisture- this iron hold up curls really well and even it loosens up - the hair has nice wavy look.
customer_reviews.author: Sims

customer_reviews.title: Burned my hair
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this product. It burned my hair regardless of what heat setting I had it on. I liked the size of the barrel but had to send it back because of what it was doing to my hair.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: You will be burnt. You will be scarred
customer_reviews.text: The black tip gets as hot as the iron itself it will melt your skin. Mostly the neck which mine now has permanent scars. Fingertips will suffer too you can't avoid touching the end.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

product_meta.title: Conair INFINITIPRO Nano Tourmaline Ceramic Curling Iron, 1-inch Curling Iron, Turquise (CD107TP)
product_meta.description:
Size:1-inchGet ready for long-lasting, medium bouncy curls. The InfinitiPro by Conair Tourmaline Ceramic Curling Iron with Nano Technology delivers beautiful, shiny curls that are sure to make you the envy of all your friends. This 1-inch barrel curling iron has an extra smooth tourmaline ceramic surface for superior performance and produces beautiful curls every time. For you science lovers out there, the curling irons nano technology fuses micro particles of tourmaline ceramic and silver to emit natural frizz-reducing ions for long-lasting curls and waves. This also ensures even heat and eliminates hot spots for less hair damage. With true ceramic heat, this curling iron heats up to 400 degrees Fahrenheit in 30 seconds and has infrared technology to generate hair-friendly heat that's gentle on hair and enhances shine. Plus this Conair curling iron offers superior performance and features a ceramic easy-glide surface to allow the hair to glide easily over the surface of the barrel as you style. That means no snags or pulls. This also makes it easy to clean off any styling product residue. With 5 precision LED heat settings, you can choose which one is best for your hair and desired style. Auto-off means you never need to worry if you left the hair curling iron on and the protective heat shield keeps you safe when handling and storing the curling iron. With the InfinitiPro by Conair Tourmaline Ceramic Curling Iron with Nano Technology, your beautiful, bouncy hair will turn heads wherever you go.

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER




See more
feature_bullets: Create silky, defined curls with the Infinitipro By Conair Tourmaline Ceramic 1 inch curling iron
Nano technology reduces frizz for healthy looking, shiny hair; Bonus protective heat shield included
400 F high heat for long lasting results with even heat, eliminating hot spots for less damage
Features uniform heat recovery; 5 precision LED heat settings; Auto off

On turning on power or low 285 degree fahrenheit setting will become illuminated; Allow unit to heat up for 30 seconds; Warning curling irons tourmaline is ceramic coated barrel will get very hot within few seconds and should not be placed in contact with the skin after the curling iron has been turned on

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
